childnodes.sy: Come to Blacksmith for the iced coffee made with a double shot of espresso and evaporated milk and stay for awesome breakfast dishes like homemade biscuits with marmalade and crème fraiche and Vietnamese-style steak and eggs.
You can try something new every day at Doshi House. The all-vegan menu of items like Thai red curry changes daily, and they make a killer coffee, too.

Montrose neighborhood coffee shop Siphon invites customers to linger over their specialty siphon-made coffees and from-scratch pastries. Be sure to grab a seat by the window if you need to plug in your laptop.

The folks at farm-to-table restaurant Down House know how to keep their customers happy with quality food and a fun atmosphere. You’re sure to be pleased by the smoked Gouda grilled cheese, kimchi burger, or pretty much anything else on the seasonal.

You have to keep an eye out for Southside Espresso, a hidden gem tucked away on a side street. The super-chill atmosphere makes this a great place to sip a cappuccino and work on your laptop for a couple of hours… or you can go another way and enjoy.

Serving coffee, wine, sandwiches and pastries in the Museum District, BOSTA has all of your culinary and spiritual needs covered. You’ll find featured red, white and sparking wines for just $5 at happy hour, and half off wines by the glass or bottle.
Tamales, French toast and fresh-squeezed OJ make for a complete and delicious breakfast at Brasil. You can find parking on the residential streets behind the restaurant.

Inspired by the outdoor cafes of Austin, Onion Creek may be the answer to your patio-dining dreams. Crowd-pleasing entrees and snacks like pizza, burgers, salads, nachos and fried pickles, plus a DJ spinning every Wednesday night.

A craft butcher shop, a grocery specializing in locally sourced items, and a café all in one, Revival Market is your one-stop shopping and dining destination. Come on a Saturday to try one of their rotating breakfast dishes like house-made bagels.

Antidote can get you going in the morning with a great cup of coffee, and if you need something stronger, they also serve beer and wine until midnight. Do yourself a favor and try one of their wonderful pastries as well.

If you’re hungry in east downtown Houston, head to Toot Suite and order the open-faced salmon and egg sandwich & avocado and honey toast. Plenty of charging stations make this a great spot for work collaboration — aka the tastiest meeting spot ever.
Coffee and caffeine are a potent mix, and Midtown’s Double Trouble has them both. Come between 4pm to 8pm Monday through Friday for happy hour — you’ll be glad you did.

t: Perk Up! 12 Hot Houston Coffee Spots
